reviewText: Savio Vega VS Owen Hart: Both men could wrestle. Sadly, it has one of the dumbest endings in WWF/WWE history. Hart hits Vega with his cast in front of the ref and Vince plays it off as the ref not being able to see the cast when it happened right in front of him. It was stupid and ruined a decent match.Smoking Gunns VS Bodydonna's VS Godwinns VS New Rockers: Ah, gimmicks so bad you can smell crap coming from your tv set. Listen, all four men could wrestle but were given crappy names. This was a good match and was helped by the lovely Sunny being at ringside. I hate to say see was sleeping with half the locker room but who knows. Smoking Gunns wins in anther stupid finish. Sunny then cuts a heel promo.Britsh Bulldog VS Sid: Wow, Bulldog being treated as a jobber? I dont know what he did but he deserved better. Sid wins in a quick squash.Marc Mero VS Goldust: A decent match up between two men who could wrestle. I hate to say this but it was hard to ignore, Goldust had a big buldge in his pants. Hey Dust, cover it up! The match itself was decent but they would have better matches.Sunny comes out with Faarooq Asad, a new comer. Who says she got around? Anyways, he says something about being IC champion and Ahmed Johnson. Anther crappy WWF gimmic circa 95-96, im glad they survived it.Jake Roberts VS Jerry Lawler: Lawler talks and talks. Trys to give Roberts an oversized bottle, Roberts pulls out his snake and puts it on Lawler and he runs out. Mark Henry did guest commentary by the way. The match itself sucked and was a waste of time.Undertaker VS Mankind: I love hardcore matches but some are by the books. This was a Boiler Room brawl so it was suppose to be different. Well I never got thru this whole match because it sounded stupid. Paul Bearer turns on Undertaker at the end, the only part worth watching.Vader VS Shawn Michaels: A decent match up. Vader's career never fully recovered in America after jobbing out to Hulk Hogan in WCW. WWF tried to build him as a monster but that failed. He had a few good matches but can anyone remember what he did? This match had two false finshes until HBK finally pins Vader. A good match but not a classic.Overall, anther weak year for WWF. I dont remember why Bret Hart was out but he might have helped this poor card. No matches are really worth going out of the way for.
Title: WWF: Summerslam 1996 VHS

reviewText: This SummerSlam was one of the better ppv's in over a year!  I mean this started out with Owen Hart beating Savio Vega and it was very comical.  The rest of the card up until the Boiler Room Brawl was back and forth average and above average matches.  Nothing really spectaculer until the brawl.  Now Mandkind and Undertaker put on a hell of a battle.  This was the most hardcore I have seen in the WWE since Diesel VS HBK IN UR HOUSE.  I think wat Vince was doing was trying to do the same thing as WCW and make PAul Bearer turn on the taker just like HOgan did to Savage.  SO after Mandkind won HBK pinned vader in what was a pretty good paced DAVID vs GOLIATH type main eventOverall a 8/10 ppv
Title: WWF: Summerslam 1996 VHS

reviewText: Once again, thanks to WWE Classics On Demand, I relived another classic event; this time being the 1996 edition of SummerSlam. Now during this time, Shawn Michaels was the WWF Champion & taking on all comers who were willing to take his gold. However, a month before at International Incident, HBK was beat in a six man tag (which for those keeping track, was the first time, Shawn had been pinned since before WrestleMania) & the man that did it was the man they call, Vader leading to this match. Also, the bitter feud between The Undertaker & Mankind continued here in the first ever Boiler Room Brawl. But the one thing that this event did succeed was that this event heavily made up & surpassed the awful SummerSlam from the previous year with a better card.Owen Hart vs Savio Vega. This was during the period where Owen was wearing a cast for his injured hand, which did become a factor in this match at one point in time. Before that however, these two underrated performers went in & had a good back & forth encounter that did a great job in getting the crowd pumped up for the night with an ending that was not only typical Owen but a page out of Bob Orton's playbook.Elimination Match: WWF Tag Team Champions The Smoking Gunns vs The Godwinns vs The Bodydonnas vs The New Rockers. A couple of interesting notes to mention here was that Sunny was originally a part of the Bodydonnas but here she was managing the Gunns, this was the SummerSlam debut of Leif Cassidy (who would later be known as Al Snow), Zip & the Godwinns while this was the first time that the tag team titles were on the line in this kind of match. Anyways, this was another good match to watch but if you look closely, you could tell that the Gunns were running into a break up due to the attitude that Billy Gunn kept showing when it came to Sunny.Sycho Sid vs British Bulldog. This was the beginning of the best run of Sid's career as this was actually a much better match than you would normally expect from Sid as he & Bulldog had a nice powerhouse match with moments of both men using their power moves like the powerbomb & running powerslam. The bigger story here though was the appearance of Mason that would become a factor in not only the match but in the upcoming weeks.It was around here that there was an interview with Faarooq Assad (who would later be known as just Faarooq) who was scheduled to face Ahmed Johnson for the Intercontinental Championship (which by the way, didn't happen due to Ahmed's first series of injuries)Goldust vs Marc Mero. This was one of those matches that was focused more on another storyline that actually involved Mankind but also Sable which kinda took the attention away from this match. Not saying that this was a bad match at all but it just seemed to come off as a filler but a decent one nonetheless as both men worked well together.Jerry Lawler vs Jake Roberts. The angle for this feud was based off Jake's real life substance abuse problems which was actually kinda sad to see. On top of that, Lawler brought an oversized bottle with him & just like the opener, it became a factor in this match. However unlike the opener, this match wasn't very good at all.Boiler Room Brawl: The Undertaker vs Mankind. This was the most unique match that the WWF had did at the time as these two would start in the Boiler Room & you have to exit the Boiler Room & make your way to the ring where Paul Bearer was at to take position of the urn to win the match. This was really something to see for it's time as they brawled all over the Boiler Room with weapons like a steel pipe, a ladder & various other things coming into play before both men left the room to battle in the backstage area & eventually making it to the ring which lead to one of the most shocking turns in WWF history. Again for it's time, this was a wild & entertaining affair with quite the ending in the classic Taker/Mankind feud.WWF Champion Shawn Michaels vs Vader. This was hyped up as HBK's biggest challenge yet as he was facing a much larger opponent who was not only very agile for his size but holds a pinfall victory over him. Shawn was always able to have a great series of matches with bigger men & this was no exception. This was probably Vader's best WWF match as they told a great story here with Vader being the dominate monster & overpowering Shawn on many occassions while Shawn had to use his speed & quickness to even get some surprising offense on Vader. There were many restarts in this match with HBK getting counted out at one point & later disqualified before the match continued after all that in which Shawn was able to survive & retain his title. Just a great main event & again perhaps Vader's best WWF match.Overall, this was a much better edition than the 1995 edition as the WWF got it right here & for the most part delivered great action along with shocking twists to storylines that they were pushing at the time. This is one event that I would recommend.
summary: Is It HBK's Time Or Vader Time?
Title: WWF: Summerslam 1996 VHS

reviewText: I'm flying through these WWF Pay Per Views this review is for Summerslam 1996. At this time WCW had the NWO angle going on for about 3 months WWF at this time was ok & put on some pretty good TV but they still had goofys  h  i  t like The Godwins, The Bodydonna's Aldo Montoya, TL Hopper The Goon Triple H still had his snob gimmick going on. They had a good champion in Shawn Michaels Undertaker  was in his 1st meaningful feud since 1994 Steve Austin since winning King Of The Ring was in a featured role. You had some great characters like Goldust & Mankind. The talent was fine Ahmed Johnson Vader Owen Hart & The British Bulldog. But still The WWF was about 9 or 10 months from becoming better than WCW imo. To me The Summer Of 1997 was when it was better it just took awhile for the ratings to reflect it. Gettinng to the note worthy events leading into this show on The July 22nd episode of RAW Vader got a shot for The WWF Championship at Summerslam. The following week on RAW Jim Cornette decided to have another debate with Jose Lathero Cornette verbally owned him but was knocked out by Jose Lathero once again. Backstage Shawn Michaels was attacked by Mankind & had The Mandible Claw put on him. The following week on RAW Kevin Kelly had a sit down interview with Shawn Michaels. He said that he never said that he was invincible he is a regular guy he just happens to be a WWF Superstar. He was asked about Bret Hart complaining about the over time in The Iron Man Match back at Wrestlemania. He said that he hopes that Bret Hart returns. The next week on RAW after defeating Owen Hart Vader came out beat up Shawn scared off Referee's & gave Shawn a couple of Vader Bombs. On The August 5th episode of RAW there was a Battle Royale to determine The NO 1 Contender to The WWF title after Summerslam Undertaker & Mankind eliminated each other fought all over the arena back to the ring all the way to the back it was a wild brawl. On The July 22nd episode of RAW Ahmed Johnson teamed up with Shawn Michaels to go for The WWF Tag Team Championship during the match Faarooq Asad came debuted & attacked Ahmed Johnson & rammed his back into the ring post. The next week on RAW they announced that Ahmed Johnson had a Ruptured Kidney Faarooq challenged Ahmed for The Intercontenintal Championship at Summerslam. The following week on RAW Ahmed Johnson won The Battle Royale to face The WWF Champion the night after Summerslam. Faarooq came out they started fighting to close the show. The following week on RAW they announced that Ahmed Johnson had to have surgery for his Ruptured Kidney they had to intercut stuff into these RAW's cause they were taped including where Gorilla Monsoon vacated the title. For weeks Jerry Lawler was getting personal with Jake "The Snake" Roberts. On The July 27th episode of Superstarts Lawler lost to Aldo Montoya. On The August 5th episode of RAW Jerry Lawler beat him in a rematch. Then he poured Jim Beam down his throat. The following week they announced that Jerry "The King" Lawler would face Jake "The Snake" Roberts at Summerslam. Finally The WWF signed Mark Henry to a 10 year deal. That is the backstory going into this event. The buyrate was a 0.58 that is down from last years Summerslam which got a 0.95.The current WWF Champions at the time wereWWF Champion Shawn Michaels March 31st 1996WWF Inercontenintal Champion Ahmed Johnson June 23rd 1996 vacated August 12 1996WWF Tag Team Champions The Smoking Gunns Billy & Bart May 26th 1996Date August 18, 1996Attendance 17,000Venue Gund ArenaCity Cleveland, OhioFree For AllThere is a Bikini Beach Blast Off featuring Sunny, Sable & MarlenaStone Cold Steve Austin Def Yokozuna DUD the biggest win for Austin so farJim Ross interviewed The Undertaker & Paul Bearer. Paul Bearer said that The Urn will be safe while you take care of Mankind. The Unertaker said that tonight I will extiguish the flame of Mankind. My Creatures Of The Night will rejoyce when I leave your remains in The Boiler Room. Then I will get back to this ring & then the funeral will begin.Todd Pettengill talked to Jerry Lawler at poolside he said "If this pool were full of beer you know that Jake "The Snake" Roberts would be out here don't you think?"Dok Hendrix interviewed Shawn Michaels who said that he doesn't enjoy being the underdog but he doesn't have a choice. He also said that when I let The Kliq down it's personal.Getting to this Pay Per View the opening is really good.Owen Hart Def Savio Vega *** a good opener going through these old WWF shows I forgot how fun Owen Hart is to watch. Justin Hawk Bradshaw came out he yelled at the commentators about Savio Vega. Then he struck Savio from behind.Todd Pettengill was in The Boiler Room where Mankind was at Mankind said that there's no place like home. He licked a tank in The Boiler Room. He said that a fate worse than death awaits The Undertaker.4 Corners EliminationWWF Tag Team ChampionshipChampions The Smoking Gunns Billy & Bart with Sunny Def The Bodydonnas Skip & Zip, The Godwins Henry & Phinnes with Hillybilly Jim & The New & Improved Rockers Marty Janetty & Leif Cassidy *Billy Gunn pinned Zip to eliminate The Bodydonna'sPhinnes Godwin pinned Leif Cassidy to eliminate The New & Improved RockersBilly Gunn pinned Phinnes to eliminate The Godwins to retain the titles *in a p  i  s  s poor & boring 4 corners elimination match. Sunny got on the mic & said The Smoking Gunns are what real men are suppose to look like.They showed The Supertars doing various actvites in ClevelandSycho Sid Def The British Bulldog with Clerance Mason * another poor match Cornette came down & argued with Clerance MasonA promo for The Shawn Michaels Jean Jacket was shown.Goldust Def Marc Mero * & 3 quarters of a star an ok match you had Mankind come out & mess with Sable. Mero hit a beautiful Shooting Star Press. Goldust started messing with Sable after he won Mero beat Goldust up.Then they show what happend to Ahmed Johnson & a Tournament will start the next night on RAW as well there will be a 4 corners match with the final 4 from The Battle Royale.Todd Pettengill interviewed Faarooq Asad & Sunny I would like to know who's idea it was to pair Ron Simmons & Sunny together cause they didn't click at all. Faarooq wants The Intercontenintal Championship handed to him. Sunny said Faarooq is what a real man is all about. She added whatever Sunny wants Sunny gets.They show what lead up to Jerry Lawler vs Jake "The Snake" Roberts.Mark Henry did commentary for this match.Jerry "The King"Lawler Def Jake "The Snake" Roberts DUDLawler comes out with a bag he is wearing a Baltimore Ravens Jearsy cause The Ravens moved from Cleveland to Baltimore. He buries the city & he said he brought Jake's 2 tag team partners Jim Beam & Jack Daniels. Then he went after Mark Henry pretty bad. King offers a giant bottle of wine to Jake. Roberts runs him off with a snake. Getting to this match this was just as  hit  t  y match. It was a burial of Jake Roberts. Lawler poured Jim Beam down Jake's throat after the match then he went for The Jack but Mark Henry stopped him. I have noticed that Lawler has been in a lot of King Of The Ring, Summerslam & Survivor Series matches & they stunk up the joint.Video package for The Undertaker vs Mankind in a Boiler Room Brawl is shown.Paul Bearer comes out to the ring cause the way to win is to retrive The UrnBoiler Room BrawlMankind Def The Undertaker **** & half stars 5+ for Paul Bearer turning on The UndertakerThere is very little commentary for this match that helped this match cause it gave this real fight feel to an extent. The camera going out was a problem but great match overall. Foley dominated this match. Whenever The Undertaker got some offense in Foley took some sick bumps. The weapon use is insane which is great there are times weapon use is uncalled for & there's times that it is called for & this match was perfect for it. When Undertaker got into the ring to retrive The Urn Paul Bearer doesn't give him The Urn & Mankind jumps into the ring puts The Mandible Claw on Undertaker. Paul Bearer laughs at The Dead Man. Undertaker crawled to Paul Bearer to get The Urn Paul Bearer hit him over the head with The Urn Mankind took possession of The Urn for the win. Then some Druids came & took Undertaker off.  This feud not The NWO got me into Professional Wrestling.Dok Hendrix interviewed Jim Cornette & Vader good promo.WWF ChampionshipChampions Shawn Michaels with Jose Lathero Def Big Van Vader with Jim Cornette **** DUD for Shawn Michaels being unprofessionalShawn Michaels was over like nobody's business. I don't know if Vader was suppose to win the title or not. But the spot where Shawn Michaels goes for the elbow drop & stops Shawn said in his book that he wanted him to move you can hear Shawn yell move. Basically Vader was suppose to move when Shawn went for the elbow drop Shawn would've stopped himself & then dropped an elbow on Vader. If Vader was suppose to win the title or if Shawn Michaels was meant to retain he still acted unprofessional. Shawn was counted out Jim Cornette demaned the match be restarted so the match continues. Later on Cornette threw his Tennis Racket into the ring Shawn Michaels got ahold of it & hit Vader with it a few times & he was disqualified. Cornette demanded the match to continue. It was Shawn barley won.This Pay Per View is hard to judge cause you had a a good opener with Owen Hart & Savio Vega. Boiler Room Brawl was great. Despite that little bit of unprofessionalism by Shawen Michaels his match with Vader was great. But the undercard is garbage once again. You had a poor Tag Team 4 Corners Match. Sid vs Bulldog was a poor match too. Lawler vs Roberts was the trash of the night. So my score is as nice as possible had it not been for the last 2 matches this Pay Per View would've been worse than International Incident. I know Vince was putting things in place for the future & 1996 WWF isn't that bad when you compare it with 1993, 1995 or the past 6 years of WWE cause WWF was ok in 1996 TV was more than decent but still at this time it's no wonder that WCW was owning The WWF.
summary: Summerslam 1996 review aka Shawn Michaels acts unprofessional 7.5/10
Title: WWF: Summerslam 1996 VHS

reviewText: 1996 SummerslamAugust 17, 1996Gund ArenaCleveland, OhioOwen Hart v. Savio VegaDecent opener with Owen doing his best to make Vega look good. Owen wins! **Four Corners Elimination Match for the WWF Tag Team Championship:The Smoking Gunns (Champions) v. The New Rockers v. The Godwinns v. The BodydonnasNot much to say here. Really boring. Gunns retain. 3/4*British Bulldog v. SidThe Sid push begins..um...that means Sid wins. *Goldust v. Marc MeroThis was the match i thought would steal the show but it was subpar. Thought it was going to be alot better than it was. Goldie wins *3/4 However Mero gets the last laugh as he wins the Intercontinental title a month later.Jerry Lawler v. Jake RobertsDrinkng jokes turn into a DUD of a match & a Lawler winBoiler Room Brawl:The Undertaker v. MankindThis match was missing something but still some great bumps & weapons used. Mankind wins cuz Paul Bearer turns on Undie!! ***WWF Championship:Shawn Michaels (Champion) v. VaderGood match with TWO dusty finishes. Shawn worked his off ass to have a good match but its probably his worst title match in his first run as champ. Shawn retains. ***1/4Overall just a horrible show but the effort was there.
summary: One of the worst summerslams ever!!
Title: WWF: Summerslam 1996 VHS
